description: Amazing! Fish was excellent, tartar sauce was amazing! would come back! Also some really good prices for the food quantity!
author: Russel R.

description:
Gross! Resist the urge to come here, even if you're craving fish and chips. I don't care if you're drunk at midnight on Polk --don't go.  

Razor-thin fillets of [fish type=?] in a bland tempura batter fried in oil that isn't the right temperature so you bite in and hot grease dribbles out. Not crispy: mushy.

Chips that are piping hot but rubbery--no crisp at all.  

When you get a case of dirty grease cramps from this place, don't come cryin' to me because you've been warned.

And the owners? They don't speak a lick of English, even from their own menu. This is not a chipper; this is a cash-only money laundering operation that involves Chinese indentured servitude.  Look it up.
author: Amy R.

description:
I like authentic hole in the walls but the fish burned my mouth it was so hot. Then I got a bad stomach ache and diarrea, which smelled so bad it was hard not to throw up. 
Food poisoning and stomach virus are usually the only things to make it come out at both ends. So I would say this place is one notch ahead.
In all fairness it's possible something else made me sick. I did have a milk shake at super duper burger too.
author: Rabbit A.

description:
OK, the caveat, this place doesn't compare with Fish n Chips in Blighty, but - it's good enough, and the price is right. 
Takeaway chips  ...  homemade chip sandwich - melted marg dripping down your wrist ... Authentic chippies are a rarity here, why not do the supportive thing?
author: Hugh K.

description:
It's a total dive hole in the wall. But they fry your fish and chips fresh when you order. I really like that. I suppose this place gets hoping with a late night bar crowd but I usually go there for lunch and it's empty with no wait to order. 

Bare bones. Expect no frills. But if you like fish and chips this is the place. Very reasonable prices.
author: Tim P.

description:
Always pass by, first time trying despite the mixed review.  $13 for 3 fish&rings + $3 slaw

- Fish was juicy and tender, batter is light and airy 
- Rings were housemade (same batter), must add salt 
- Avoid the homemade cole slaw, diced cabbage & carrots w/ heavy coating of miracle whip
author: Dav K.

description:
Couldn't come to San Fran without getting some fish and chips. Found some mixed reviews on this one so I thought that I have to try it for myself.
It's a nondescript little cafe, with absolutely no airs or graces. The menu is up on the wall and as simple as day. Food is cooked right in front of you in a sizzling deep fryer.
All I can say is it was gorgeous, plain, simple and just like fish and chips from my home.  Lots of salt and vinegar and Bobs your uncle.  It cost $6.50 for 2 fish and a healthy dose of chips and an extra 25 cents for some tartar, tomato sauce was free.
Great place, good food, I'd definitely go back with friends.
I gave it four stars because it has room to improve, just like everywhere else
author: Tony S.

description: The prices are pretty reasonable. It was $8 for 2 large pieces of battered fish and onion rings. Nots the batter is tempura-esque and they batter the onion rings in the same manner. The first few bites were really good but after a while it just tasted like the oil they fried the food in. My roomate and I felt pretty gross afterwards and had to walk it off. If I were to order again I'd probably get the fries and fish rather than the onion rings because I feel like the similar way they were battered made the dish an overkill.
author: Kalani R.

description: Whenever I have a craving for fish n' chips, I ALWAYS come here. I've been patronizing this place for years. I always order the same: two piece fish n' chips with clams. I much prefer beer battered fish over the cornmeal type breading. My only call out with this place is that they seem to take the fish out of the fryer a tad too soon, as the batter could stand to get a little more color. Also, they charge .25 for tartar sauce.
author: Kim L.

description: Divey but satisfies the craving. Onion rings taste good but may not feel great after 1 hr.
author: Urmila J.

description:
My friend was craving fish and chips so we Yelped and decided to try this place.  My first impression upon entering was the heavy smell and feeling of grease and grime.  We had an order of the fish and chips & and an order of the fish and onion rings.  I understand that the items are all deep fried....but all the items, from the fish, fries and the onion rings were all extremely greasy and pretty flavorless.  I bit into the fish and expected to be wowed with flavor but could not find it.  The ratio of fish and batter was way off...75% batter and 25% fish.  It was a thin piece of fish surrounded by greasy batter.  Bring your own extra napkins as you are only given the number of napkins that are in your party.  It was used to absorb the grease on my food, and we were left with greasy hands when we finished our meal.  

We wasted $14 and left feeling still hungry, unsatisfied, and oily.  I will be looking elsewhere to satisfy my fish and chips craving.  I will not be returning to this place and cannot recommend it.
author: Amy D.

description: Very reasonable prices. Very simple place. Chips were very good and fish batter was also good. Eat as soon as you get it, else the batter will become soggy (which is true for all deep-fried foods).
author: Jay C.

description: Asked for chips well done. Soggy. No flavor. Fish: meh. Greasy. Service: poor. Silly, but the worst part was that the fish and chips didn't come with tartar sauce. They charged 25 cents for a tiny container. I can see charging for extra, but not including one with the $9 greasy fish and soggy chips? I won't be back.
author: Michael D.

description: No frills: simple yet tasty fish and chips. I came in around 4:30pm on a Friday and it was empty. Ordered a 3pc and took a seat. A little while later had some fresh fried food in front of me. Was very hot (temperature-wise) and stayed nice and toasty as I slowly picked my way through. Tartar sauce is $0.25 extra but seems homemade so I'm okay with it.
author: Faith C.

description: I came here today because I was craving fish and chips. I generally support the mom and pop hole in the wall types of places, but this place had the tinest pieces of fish with really thick batter and everything was unseasoned, I initially ordered the combo plate, which has fish, fried oysters and shrimp, onion rings and fries. I do not recommend this place, no matter how long it has been open.
author: Adrian M.

description:
Update!!
They now accept cash AND cards!! 

This place has been here for more than 40 years and it is by far the GREATEST Fish & Chips I've ever eaten! This Yelp review should have been written 3 years ago but I've been busy and kept pushing to next day until today after I had some Piccadilly Fish & Chips, I HAD to write one :D It is a regular battered fish/vegetables fried in their fryer and no sadly they do not carry beer batters! I can't complain about their food because their fishes and vegetables is straight FRESH and it is amazingly delicious! You guys should try the mushrooms or the zucchinis because those are the juiciest! Mmm.. Yummy! Almost forgot about their scallops and oysters but they no longer carry oysters for temporary! Oh and Don't forget to salt and vinegar em' up! You gots to have it original styled English food especially if you want to eat Fish & Chips! I can no longer order Fish & Chips from other restaurants! Piccadilly, you have taken my breath away (:
On a side note, they have fried chicken too! Sometimes they have wings and sometimes they have the whole 4 pieces set which I love the most when it comes down to chicken. It is honey battered and the crisp on that is so unbelievable! Can't forget about their homemade Tar Tar sauce! Yes they charge 25cents for one just like how any other San Francisco CORPORATE Mc Donald's charge for their sauce! I mean I don't mind paying for a family owned restaurant but Mc Donald's?! I'll save that for their review. Hehe. It's really cheap people, I can NEVER understand people when they complain about how expensive it is but people it really isn't AND it is by far the CHEAPEST Fish & Chips joint! 
Last of all, parking is NOT easy over here! I mean c'mon it's Polk street! Try not to leave any valuables in the car because whoever will break into your car and your windows will be smashed! 

Oh one more thing! They're CASH only!

P.S.
I honestly don't understand how people given such low ratings on this joint!! First of all, if you want a fine dine cuisine service and atmosphere, then goto a fine dine cuisine. This place is like any other family owned joints that you give service to yourself! It's SELF-SERVICE! How can you people be so disrespectful of this such lovely Fish & Chips restaurants because it doesn't suit your criteria?!
author: Isaac K.

description: This is a place that locals have always loved growing up in this neighborhood. Mom & pop shop with affordable prices. Their lightly battered fish is so delicious with their tartar sauce. One of the last standing businesses on Polk street that has been here for many years. Everything else on Polk is new and caters to a different crowd than it once did.
author: Jennifer S.

description: As a British ex-pat brought up on this, I can say this is the closest Fish & Chips in the Bay Area to the great British staple. Better in some regards since they cook everything to order rather than have them stacked in the warming case above the fryer. I get home a couple of times a year and Piccadilly rates with all but the very best I've had. They have a authentic, classic 1950's fryer from Cardiff, Wales which only makes everything better. They will serve the "scraps" from the fryer (loose bits of crispy batter that come off the fish and are strained out of the oil into a scraps tray) if you ask for them. Adding these to your chips is the best since it combines the nice fluffy chips with a real crunch. Plenty of salt & vinegar and you have Fish & Chips worthy of the best classic fish bar in old London Town (or preferably further north). They do other things as well (as long as they are fried) but the F&C is the best!
author: Rob R.

description:
This place is a mom and pop restaurant. We are surrounded with a lot of new pricy restaurants so it's nice to know that these restaurants still exist in the city. Basic menu and cash only.

My boyfriend and I ordered fish and chips and it was delicious! So simple but really good. 

I'll definitely come here again!
author: Jennifer B.

description: I've been coming to this place for almost 20 years with my family. The fish is tasty and fresh as well as the chips. I finally come back after awhile and they take cards now. Yayyyy. Super excited about this!!! This is the only fish n chips that's legit in the city and family owned.
author: Roberta N.

description:
Dirty little place with no atmosphere, no charm, no frills. Handwritten signs warning of a charge for tartar sauce. Really? You're going to charge for it? 

The fish was OK, that was it. Unflavorful, boring batter. The fries were undercooked. It was a horrible experience. The only good thing I can say about it was that the woman who worked there, who was sitting in the back, said thanks as I left.
author: Penguin S.

description:
This was my childhood! My dad would take me here every now and then after school when I was still attending Redding Elementary (just around the corner:)). It's great to be able to revisit and reminisce in the flavors of present past and think about just how much my city's changed. One thing I'm definitely glad about is that this place hasn't changed a bit - still the same old fryer, cheap prices and of course, the same, amazingly delicious fish wrapped in newspaper. I love getting the 2 piece fish with chips to split with one other and I'll lather my fish with vinegar. The fish is always the perfect crispy goodness and balanced with really soft (not stringy or dry), buttery white fish. Of course, all of this goes perfectly with their standard wedge style fries aka chips :). 

This place is quite the hole in the wall with very little fuss or decor. It's the place to go for a quick bite or to grab to go! :) Definitely recommend -- and if you're just feeling a snack, they serve their fried stuff a la carte for great prices too (1-piece fish at $3) - oh and they have a selection of other fried seafood and food as well! :)
author: Purnima G.

description: This place is the bomb! I don't know why it took me so long to try it out. There's never anyone there, so come give these guys some business! The owner is super friendly and nice and it's delicious!
author: Andrew K.

description:
Been here way before the change in ownership. This is a no frills type of place w/ decent food. The fish is soft and flakey and they have quite a few combos to choose from. Prices haven't gone up too much. Still good and cheap eats.

** The crab and chips used to be made w/ imitation crab but they changed it to crab cakes now instead. **
author: Julie L.

description:
Sadly Piccadilly DIDN'T stand the test of time.  A once a vibrant little mom-and-pop restaurant serving quality comfort food in a blue-collar neighborhood next to a still standing elementary school today is no longer.  The original owners have long passed and their descendants took over.  I gather ownership changed again as a recent visit made it brutally evident. 

Summary: detestable food, service, and facilities.  Its a shack masquerading as a restaurant thats barely staying afloat.  If you don't want to serve quality food within cleanly facilities with a smile and can barely speak English, then why are you independently operating a restaurant in the U.S.?  Wouldn't be surprised to see their makeshift "Cash Only" sign replaced with a 'For Lease' sign come December.

One night, I brought my friend.  First, I tried to greet the folks behind the counter with a 'Hello' and handshake.  The woman/wife glared at me with horror as though I were ripe with disease.  I politely backed off as it was clear she didn't want to hear about my childhood visits.  She and her husband immediately snarled, "No English! No English!"  Fine.  We then eyeballed the fading menu.  We got the 2-piece fish and chips and an order of onion rings.  Now a vegetarian, I asked if they fried their meats separately from their veggies.  The man barked "Fries here! Fish here! Onions here!", firmly pointing to each deep-fryer.  Thanks for clarifying, Mr. Manners. I paid nearly $14 for it all.  As we waited for our food, we noted the restaurant's disgusting condition. 

The floor and tables were greasy and dirty.  The closet of a restroom was dirty, tagged with graffiti, and dilapidated.  I had to feel my way to the light switch!  The smell of rotting grease filled the air.  Do they empty and clean their fryers?  Upon serving our food, their body language was stiff as they looked reluctant to serve us, the only patrons present.  Each piece of fish was next to the veggies.  To be safe, I asked the man to identify and confirm.  He barked "This fish! This onion rings! This fries!"  Even so, I clearly could tell otherwise.  My omnivorous friend was able to confirm my suspicions and told me the opposite.  When we both took a bite, the food was flavorless.  

My intuitions screamed louder every minute we remained.  Ultimately, I insisted we spare our stomachs, kidneys, and the night!  Although I wasted $14, I valued our friendship and wellbeing more.  I thanked the owner while telling him he could keep my money.  He snarled something in his native tongue as we headed for the door.  He should be thankful we didn't demand a refund.
author: Honest J.

description:
I was just passing by and thought I would grab some "chips", fries for my American friends for the drive home. Place looks and feels like an authentic British chippy. Chips we great, would have preferred if cooked just a couple minutes longer but loved then none the less. Got the salt and vinegar to finish them off AND they are served in news paper as they should be.
Next time when not driving will try the fish as well. 
Not much of a place to eat in but you can. Price is right as well, $3 for chips and they are real chips not the skinny French fry thing you often get.
author: Steven H.

description: Pretty sure got food poisoning from here.  Also, everything except the fried oysters (the combo comes w/ three) was mediocre to really bad, especially the fried clams that were like rubber and basically inedible.  Fries and onion rings were standard issue tasteless frozen, fish was chewy, not tender.  I almost knew when eating this food it was not going to sit well w/ me.  Think probably they just keep using the same frying oil all day (or week???) and of course its going to be cross contaminated w/ everything they put in it.  Also, not a place to go if you want take-out in a hurry as they make every order one at a time and you will have a significant wait.  Since they don't have to-go boxes, be prepared for a newspaper wrapped presentation as well - authentic yes, tidy and sanitary no.
author: Rose B.

description:
There is an assortment of food to eat on Polk Street, so while walking with my buddy we saw Piccadilly Fish & Chips and thought huh we should try it out. Our logic was out of all the places we walked by this one looked ghetto as fuck BUT it was open; so for a food joint in SF to look grungy and still be open they had to be doing something right.

The owner has been there for 53 years which solidified he knew what he was doing.

Food wise the fish was cooked thoroughly and it had a nice crisp too it. The edges had more batter than fish but it was tasty. The fries were homemade as evident by the boxes of potatoes in the backroom.

Fresh out of the batter we salted the fish and chips and added a bit of Malt vinegar and some ketchup. It didn't bother me that we had to pay $.25 for tartar sauce because a 2 piece fish and chip was $6.80 which in itself isn't expensive at all.

Will definitely come by again!
author: Stephen T.

description:
The fish is about 80% batter and ~ tasteless/frozen, quite possibly not Cod as others have noted but likely Tilapia.
The Frys are 'solid' - 
I wonder how often the owner/operator changes the fat in the fryer.
He's a cheery guy who has to deal with his fair share of nuisances coming in and out all the time you're there, but that shouldn't impact food quality etc. Cash only, and average-disappointing.
author: Steve L.

description:
Classic fish and chips. All food is made to order. I'm not sure if they take phone orders or not. 
It's a small dicey kind of place. The food is good and fresh. They wrap it in newspaper. So make sure if you want it salted you tell them before it's wrapped up. 

Cash Only

Parking is very difficult to find but I come here often and usually get a spot about a block away.

The owner cooks everything himself. Tartar sauce is 25cent extra.
author: Ayana K.

description: If you like your fish and chips crispy and toasty Brown this is not the place. I don't think they had the oil turned up high enough. I won't be back.
author: Dave R.

description:
This is the worst fish & Chips I've had in a long time...

-soggy and chewy batter
-huge uncooked fries
-you have to pay extra for tartar sauce
-rude service
-boring place with no character, no music, bland like the food.

If your specialty is fish & chips you better make sure you do it good: you need fresh cod, good crispy batter and decent fries.  This place had none of the above.  Big disappointment.
author: Monkey B.

description: Where's da fish? Somehow this place has mastered how to make the batter puff up big time around thin slivers of fish. We ordered the three piece fish and chips and on all three pieces, batter to fish ratio was more than 3:1. Fish was previously frozen, soft, and mushy. Also ordered fried oysters... poor value for the tiny size! Very disappointed.
author: Harry L.

description: Place sucks. Over priced and the food was whack... McDonald's filet o fish was better... feel bad for the older couple trying to run it but it needs to be better for the business to keep up...
author: Dong H.

description: Love this place, closest I can get to U.K. style Fish and Chips (or a Fish Supper as we say in Scotland).   Always freshly made so you know what you're getting, visit this place pretty much every time I'm in San Francisco for work...
author: John S.

description: I went to this place tonight and I must say the fish and fries are yummy. It's slightly under seasoned but really good! The batter reminds me of tempura. It was light and crispy!! The cook is friendly and inviting! I'm definitely coming back!!
author: Yip J.

description:
We made our first visit to Piccadilly this evening for an inexpensive, take-home dinner.  We both got two pieces of fish and chips.  And we asked for and were given little containers of malt vinegar.
We both agreed that the fish & chips were very good.  The fish was moist and the coating was crisp and not greasy.
We had a couple of quibbles.  It appeared that they used tilapia instead of the traditional cod.  And the thick-cut chips should have been more crisp.
But we will return.  Next time, I want to try the fried oysters with onion rings!
author: Philip C.

description:
I love fish and chips, so maybe I had very high expectations, but I was very disappointed with the food here. The prices are great, and the owner is very nice, but the food fell flat. I do appreciate the fact that your food is made to order. No soggy food here. 

I tried the fish with onion rings, but the batter was way too thick. My food was also very bland. Even with the malt vinegar and ketchup, my food lacked flavor.
author: Rachel H.

description:
Reasons To Avoid:

1.)  I ordered the fried clams and onion rings.  The portion of clams was about the size a five year old could hold in one hand and consisted of 4 normal sized clams and the rest were tiny pieces of salty fried breaded...bread crumbs?
2.)  The onion rings were soggy and under cooked, cold in the middle and the batter was "white" and flavorless.  How does a place featuring fried food screw up onion rings?
3:)  They charged an additional 25 cents for tarter sauce (the container was about the size of a quarter).  Just plain cheap and ridiculous!
4.)  The table I sat down at to eat was completely covered in a disgusting sticky substance.  This filthy layer of stickiness also covered the chair and the wall next to the table.  GROSS!

If you crave under cooked, flavorless fried food in a dining room that is dirtier than a truck stop restroom then this place is for you!  Otherwise, don't waste your money.
author: R.J. S.

description:
My buddy was getting his car cleaned after a friend yacked all over the interior so I decided to roll with and grab a bite while the job was getting done.  We wanted something really quick and simple and spotted a fish and chips joint about a block away.  I love fish and chips!

Well, we obviously ordered their signature dish, which took about 10 minutes to fry up fresh in their big fryers.  Flavor-wise, I must admit they were a bit bland, and even with with salt and vinegar, it was kind of plain.  I was surprised that they weren't served with tartar sauce but found out later they have a great homemade version.  Why wasn't it offered in the basket?!

This is a no-frills establishment and it's just a single man working there.  Prices and service were so-so, but the lack of communication regarding sauces was a let down.  There are better fish and chips joints in the area so I'll try those first before coming back.

Food: 6/10

Service: 5/10

Price: $$

Atmosphere: 5/10
author: Joe M.

description:
Under seasoned is how I would describe the food here. We got fish and chips, clams and mushrooms. The clams were the best part and I watched him pull then out of a boxed freezer package so they really can't be attributed to the restaurant. The mushrooms and fish were in the same batter, sort of halfway to pancake in thickness, slightly underdone, greasy and completely flavorless. The fries (chips) were also lacking any salt. The one star is given back for them being friendly and cooking everything made to order, which makes me think they are somewhat trying to do the right thing. 

We are in this neighborhood daily and will not be returning, especially with the Kasa Indian food right next door.
author: Arshia K.

description:
GOT A CRAVING FOR FISH & CHIPS TODAY !  

It has been years since I have been to Piccadilly Fish & Chips, though back in the day it was always after having several rounds of drinks, & shots.

Today though it was for Lunch ! 

What I love about Piccadilly is that the food is always prepared, and cooked to order , so i get to see the cook dredge each onion, and piece of fish , Yea I got an order of Fish with Onion Rings ,For me its Onion Rings over Fries every time.  

It was cool to just watch how careful , and meticulous the cook was at each stage of the preparation to prevent against cross contamination, and how he went back to the refrigerator for each order that needed to be prepared.

This was a To Go Order , so upon placing my freshly fried foods onto the paper  he then neatly folded the paper into a convenient package , and yes I got the Tarter Sauce , because I am not going to blink an eye at .25 , this is the same cost for a handful of minutes via a parking meter , or a public dryer , so for me it would be silly to skip on this finishing touch to the meal !

After a short drive back to the office cafe, and grabbing a Sweet Ice Tea , I unwrapped my bounty and dove into Decadent Batter Dipped Onion Rings , and then my 3 pieces of Perfectly Cooked Batter Dipped Fish making sure to add a touch of the Sauce with each bite ,, 

It was so so good , and an easy recommend for a lunch that cost less then $10-
author: Joseph A.

description:
One of the best Fish & Chips places I have been to in SF! And as a born and raised Brit I don't say that lightly. Down to earth place (very simple) incredibly affordable and brilliant service!!
The cod is brilliant and the chips are true English fat chips!!
author: Jalpa P.

description:
Overall it was okay. I don't know what these people are doing and I don't think they know either.

The fries were too greasy and undercooked. I felt like I was eating two tons of crunchy fried batter with a little pocket of wet greasy fish inside and a hint of cinnamon. I am not joking. Cinnamon. 

My girlfriend got the Scallops and chips. The scallops were fishy tasting and scallops are not supposed to be fishy at all. She says she would give it another try. 

It is a while later now and I experienced stomach cramps and loose stools. I don't think I will be going back. 

The frying grease is most likely at too low of a temperature or too old. At a low temperature it does not burn as fast and you can use it to fry more meals but, it causes the issues I discussed. Soggy fries and soggy fish in a crunchy batter.
author: Morgan H.

description: Have come here twice during "open hours" only to find them closed. Today it's 7:30 p.m. on a Wednesday and they are closed. WTF???
author: Hakim A.

description: Honestly I feel for the owners but their food is overpriced and terrible, super greasy the fish was way too oily. The fries were terribly cooked. I won't be returning to this place ever. No ac
author: Pala V.

description: This place is & always has been a favorite of mine. I don't live in the city anymore, but I try to come here every chance I get. It's a place that hasn't changed in a neighborhood that has drastically changed. They still serve your fish & chips old school style- wrapped in newspaper!
author: heather r.

description:
While fish and chips can be found in many restaurants around the city, so far only 2 shops specialize on British-style fish and chips (wrapped in newspaper for to go orders, seasoned with salt and malt vinegar). http://media3.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/l80LT6GNlEvYL6r64qd8NQ/l This Piccadilly Fish & Chips http://media2.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Pxv1WxEdoVF8lrWq3Os1aw/l on Polk, and Old Chelsea on Larkin street.

In the past I'd have said that the food at OC was better than PFC, but nowadays OC is usually understaffed (often running orders to nearby Edinburgh Castle Pub) so quality is not consistent. Both stores are related somehow because prices and menu options are identical, but they were owned by different Korean families (Kim's PFC & Kang's OC). Perhaps both families are related? don't know.

Super friendly Mr. Kim was no longer here on my latest visit. In September of this year Mr. Kim transferred ownership of PFC to the Kang brothers, owners of OC. They are currently remodeling the kitchen area inside.

Hours: 11am-11pm daily. Cash only.
Every table has salt and malt vinegar, if u want tartar sauce just ask at the counter.
author: Luis C.

description: The place is kinda dingy and run down, but the fish and chips are awesome and the staff are friendly. I love this little hole in the wall shop.
author: Da V.

description: I had the fish and chips at this establishment it was OK you definitely didn't have the feel of generations at sea and the food spelled that out but it was adequate.
author: Ryan C.

description:
My boyfriend is British, and we were craving some proper chips from a Fish & Chip shop, so we popped in here. He had been once before quite awhile ago, and remembered it being alright. 

The place was empty. We ordered some chips to share. We saw a decent/average amount of chips go into the fryer, but then after a few minutes, another customer walked in and ordered some fish and chips, but they didn't put any more chips into the fryer!
So, I'm not sure what happened, but all I can say is for $3, our portion of chips was RIDICULOUSLY small. I mean, there were only about  8 fries. It was pathetic and we were upset.  He asked if we wanted them salted and malted, and when I walked over to get our order my jaw dropped at the tiny portion. We think the other customer got our other half of the chips, since no more were added to the fryer for his order. It was incredibly lame. The chips were merely average as well, and they seemed under fried. They were kinda mushy and gummy. I was not impressed by any means. 

I will not be coming back. 

1 star for having a Fish & Chip shop in SF, but come on? How are you going to charge so much? I wish I would have opened my big mouth and said "that's it!?!" instead of just being bitter and angry here on Yelp.

Cash Only.
author: Rebecca G.

description: Dude used his hands to grab and dip the chicken and pretty sure he just" washed his hands" with water.
author: Anthony M.

description: Got the vibes like from Kitchen Nightmares. Bland fish bland breading bland fries. Worst of all, it was all soft and not at all crispy. Not even a slice of lemon to help at all. Sorry. Can't recommend and won't be back.
author: Hill E.

description:
It's okay, not great. Came for lunch yesterday.

They have the coolest cash register because it's so old.

Ordered:
-Combination (1 piece of fish, 2 prawns, 3 oysters, onion rings, & chips) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/haF3hGlqzeLYmNJ-0cq5yA?select=3RoLzVZApBAaiXP4fQ32nA I think this was a little under $10
-2 pieces of fish with chips for $6 something...

If you order out, they'll ask if you want salt & vinegar & if you want it, they'll mix it in with your fried goods. We said we wanted it, I'm not
sure if it made it taste better...actually, I think I prefer it without it.

For 2 people, it was a lot of food.

Fish & onion rings were a bit too oily. The oysters, chips & prawns were really good. The oysters had to be the best. Chips were nice & thick. Prawns were nice & crunchy.

BF said it was much much better last time, this time it was just okay. I will probably venture out again and I hope it's a lot better next time. Maybe they'll get a higher rating from me next time. These weren't the best fish n chips I've had, had better in New Zealand. I'm sure there's a better place around here in the Bay Area, I'll have to find it. I guess that's my next quest.

Not bad for about $16.50

Parking wasn't too bad. Lots of meter parking. Parked a block away in the residential area, I think so free parking. I think it was on Larkin, which is a block parallel to Polk St.
author: Kylie L.

description:
Fried food deliciousness in the best way! Fish, clams, and chips are my personal favorites. Everything was nice and crispy. The guy (chef, cashier, waiter, etc.) was super nice and friendly. 

I hate to say it, but with rents skyrocketing around the city, and a ton of places on Polk going out of business and moving, I'm not sure how much longer this old school spot will be here. Get some old school crispy deliciousness while you can!
author: Mirabella Y.

description:
I was in the mood for fish and chips (obviously) and was referred by a local. The inside is very minimal: few tables and chairs, eco friendly waste baskets, and a deep fryer. What more could you need? Apparently more than Piccadilly had to offer. :/  I ordered two fish with chips ($6.80, CASH ONLY) and waited ten minutes. The fish was greasy and heavily battered and the fries tasted frozen -- it was a big disappointment. If my two options were Piccadilly or Long John Silver's, I'd choose the latter! Also, why are Yelpers raving about the homemade tartar sauce!? It tasted funky.. and not in a "funky-fresh" good sorta way.

Positive:
Piccadilly wraps their fish and/or chips in newspaper. It definitely gives their food the personality its lacking.
author: Jennae H.

description: Made to order fried fish and onion rings. Add salt and malted vinger to them and taste pretty good.  Good price.  They have chicken, other seafood and fried desserts too.
author: Yue Wing C.

description: I agree with another,  who wrote that the chips taste frozen.   I ate one and left the rest.   The fish,  however is excellent.   Add some malt vinegar and Crystal, for the win!   I wouldn't bother with the tartar sauce if you're on the fence.
author: Tamar D.

description:
This place is the best for reasonable and delicious Fish & Chips.

Always have a good and filling meal when I come here.

Service is prompt and friendly.
author: Daniel P.

description: The small one man shops have to be good if they lasted so long.  Seems this guys knows what he's doing.  Had the Fish and the Oyster with chips.  I would not say it was the best, but good for the price.  My husband and I want to try the crab (which is formed like mini crab cakes when we return).
author: Daphnie A.

description:
This place is truly awful. Just disgusting.
I left my plate of fish n chips 3/4 uneaten.
I have never had worse food.
author: Paul H.

description:
I had been wanting to try Piccadilly Fish & Chips for quite a while. What a disappointment. 

I ordered the 2-piece fish and chips, $6.80. Everything looked great, fresh fish dipped in batter and fried as you you ordered. Nothing sitting under heat lamps. After a short wait my order was up, looking great and served piping hot. A few splashes of malt vinegar and on to my first bite. Hot and crispy and perfectly cooked, but bland...very bland. Zero seasoning, zero salt on fries, not good. 

Portion size was very fair, pricing excellent, but it could make up the the lack of seasoning. I doubt I'll be back.
author: Dave J.

description: Everybody please support this spot. I don't order fish and chips at most places because the fact is most places don't do it right! Picadilly does. I had to pieces of perfect fish and crispy chips.  Issac the young man who will be the owner one day was really cool.  He is proud of his family business and was exceptional in serving me! He told me about the 75 year history of the place and how his family took over many decades ago. Come on people this place is  a SF treasure.  Don't be afraid fried  food gets a bad rap but good food is good food. I plan to return to try other items soon.
author: Jose O.

description:
We love this place!  Cash Only!

This place is such a go-to in the neighborhood.  The food is wrapped in newspaper, and the tartar sauce is made in small batches!  So it's totally worth the extra $.25.

We get fried oysters, multiple orders at a time. lol  Right out of the fryer, it gets hit with sea salt and if you like, with vinegar.
author: Isa H.

description:
I really like this place,  the owner is really nice and courteous and the fish is pretty good not the greatest but the best in this area.   

Go with the onion rings instead of the fries though is my only recommendation.

Oh yeah and it's cash only,  always a minus in my book.
author: Carlos M.

description: This is a hiding gem! If you're looking for a good F&C place pretty close to what you would have in England, this is it! .What good about this place is the quality of the fish, its cod, good cod not pollock (that cheaper cod replacement fish) & the price! This is still very reasonable $$$ for the great quality fish. If you're in the mood for F&C, this is it! The inside isn't anything fancy and sign on the out side might throw you off but this is SF, the best place here look like this. Once you meet the owner, you'll understand none of that matters. Make sure to say hi, nicest guy in the world! He's the only  one that works there!
author: J M.

description: Charging for tartar sauce?! This is fish n chips, dude! Just raise your prices! It was also looking dirty and sorely needed ventilation. How this place is still in business is beyond me.
author: Cameron E.

description: I don't even know where to start. My first impression of the place was "this place looks like a fucking laundry mat". My friend and I walked in and it was COMPLETELY EMPTY. Like most reviews said, the fries were soggy and the fish was horrible. I understand it's cheap, but food shouldn't be this bad. Right off the bat, you can tell it wasn't deep fried enough. All you taste from the fish was old oil and batter. They charge 25 cents for tarter sauce, but the guy was nice enough to give it to us for free. I guess it's because we were the only customers for that month. Also, the sauce tasted like soap and Cole slaw put together. Yuck . Please save your money and invest it in food that is considered edible.
author: Jimmy L.

description: Great place for lunch and a snack I highly recommend coming here. Their fish and chips is something I crave for and look forward to every time I go there. The owner is very friendly and everything's cooked fresh to order. Best fish and chips in San Francisco. Look forward to coming again.
author: Clayton L.

description: Had the 2pc fish and chips with a corn dog. Food was decent. Mom & pop were friendly. Overall A-OK!
author: Stephen Y.

description: I've never been to Picadilly aka Frozen "Vandekamps" where the type of fish is unknown and the fries were frozen right b4 putting them in old grease & prior to that some potatoes were sitting in a bucket next to some trash..prices are lower online..never again!!! Remember the fish is prolly "Boxed" from FoodCo or the $1 store
author: Crystal B.

description: been an alltime favorite of mine for fish and chips for years....until now. they changed ownership and the place went down the toilet. horrible fish-no crispy coating like before. fries tasted like they come from a freezer case. the last owners used REAL potatoes!!!!!!. i will never go there again.
author: Scott S.

description:
When the elderly gentleman is working the fryer it is a joy to walk into the restaurant.  He always seems to be happy and genuinely welcomes all of the patrons as soon as they open the door.

It's a pretty basic set up.  There is an overhead menu (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/haF3hGlqzeLYmNJ-0cq5yA?select=7HDhwAft71dZpuahpp0VPA) that you order from, and I've noticed most people do take out.  I've always had my food there on one of the sturdy wooden chairs and wobbly wooden tables.  The restaurant has updated copies of the daily Examiner or the latest SF Weekly to keep patrons informed while they wait for their food.

For tonight's visit I had a 3 piece fish with chips (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/haF3hGlqzeLYmNJ-0cq5yA?select=lA-mFqLiaNIfdI-MA2Dm3Q).  When dining at the restaurant you have the option of adding your own salt and malt vinegar whereas for take out they'll actually add it for you before wrapping your order with a clean sheet of white paper with newspaper on the outside.  Tartar sauce is available upon request as it is usually stored inside the refrigerator.

I decided to have my meal without the added salt, vinegar or tartar sauce for a change.  The fish is very good.  The choice filets of white fish are thick and firm and the crispy batter has just a tad of seasoning in it to keep it from tasting bland.  The chips or fries (because that's what they are) could be improved because no matter how long they sit in the fryer the outsides never seem to be crispy enough.  These are fat fries with lots of meat in the middle, but often I tend to taste the oil instead of the actual potato.

If you're not certain what you'd like to try Piccadilly offers a combination platter also.  The combination includes one piece of fish, two pieces of shrimp, three oysters and four onion rings all served over a layer of fries (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/haF3hGlqzeLYmNJ-0cq5yA?select=3p7MjyVby4e8IwjXltHA1g).  All of the seafood and the fresh rings of white onion are dipped in the same batter and put into the fryer.  While I enjoyed the flattened, butterflied shrimps and the mini oysters the hot, creamy onions just didn't seem to taste right when matched with the batter.

I love the fried mushrooms too.  Friendly service.  Open until 11 PM on most nights.  Pay before you eat or after.  Cash only.  Maybe 3.5 stars but I've rounded up this time because the old guy's smile is infectious.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: First  and last time I will ever go there. The food was greasy and no seasoning. Undercooked and why should I have to pay for tartar sauce
author: Diangela D.

description: I really wanted to give this place a good review, but I'm afraid I can't. I ordered the 2 piece fish + onion rings.  You can't beat the prices, the ingredients were fresh, and it was made to order, super piping hot.  As for the batter, it reminded me of tempura batter.  Unfortunately what I got wasn't golden brown, light and crunchy, it was a sad pale yellow, heavy and mushy.  The flavor was way too bland (and I tend to not like salty), so I bought some of the homemade tartar sauce, which tasted great.  Maybe I will give it another chance to see if my first experience was an 'off day'.  I give it a 2 and 1/2 stars.
author: Lawree S.

description: I have one thing to say about 250 undercooked fries and the nasty ass atmosphere it sucks take me to come into the 2015 and putting decorations up that are nice looking paint the plates fix the ceiling get rid of tired ass coolers do something to make it look inviting and learn how to make french fries and fish everything else is OK but that fish you need to make sure that it's golden brown and not half ass to cook fish
author: Rick L.

description:
You're a greasy time Piccadilly Fish & Chips.
I wouldn't have it any other way.
I had a cola and and some deep fried potatoes and fish for a dinner I did not plan on and while it wasn't what I wanted it was something that made me think about life. The vinegar, ketchup, the tartar sauce, what do these things mean metaphorically?
What are people thinking when they stare at me stuffing my face in the window seat?
Why wasn't i drinking beer?
Why The hell was I on Polk Street?
Would I go back to Seattle for another visit?
How much sunscreen should I pack when I head to the dessert for a couple days?
Does my conga drumming make me a tool?
Do fish and chips really have any flavor?
Should I learn to operate a forklift?
(feel free to answer these questions)
The employees were pleasant and made me feel welcome.
I left a better man.
author: Alexander R.

description:
The people here are super sweet. I mean, I practically wanted to hug the nice man who took our order and gave us our food. Lovely, lovely man.

Sadly, the batter on the fish didn't quite do it for me. I guess I'm more of a beer batter kinda gal. Still, it satisfied my fish and chip craving and left me with enough room for dessert. Woo hoo!
author: Loli L.

description:
Time to try a different Fish & Chips.

This is not the owners who cared about their business.
author: BigJohnS F.

description:
They make their fish and chips onsite and it is the freshest I've ever had. I think they could fry anything up and it would taste good. I'm going to bring them a snickers bar, a twinkie the next time I go to test this theory out. 

P.S Eat it there otherwise it WILL get soggy and thus unappealing.
author: Norris T.

description:
So disappointing. I wanted crispy fried fish and oysters with golden fries. Out of oysters:-/  Then the fish was fried in oil that was not hot enough, rendering the batter not thoroughly cooked and heavy-gummy.  As well the oil tasted old, not quite rancid but having absorbed too much oders. The shrimp were the frozen boxed kind, probably already breaded.  The fries might have been handcut however the oil temp being too low assured they were not cooked enough and bland.  The homemade coleslaw was a mixture of cabbage and some butter lettuce and had an overly sweet dressing with no balance of vinegar.  As my husband says, alors la, c'etait degueulasse. What a waste of $21.
Oh and we were sick for 2 days till it was completely out of our system!
author: Holly L.

description:
Mmm, if you're looking for that Friday night feast I'd say this is the place to look! As many meals, this should be eaten on the spot - fresh & delicious! 
A con was that they closed before the time on yelp but was generous enough to make us the last meal of the day!
author: Nathaniel N.

description:
As a Brit I've been looking for decent fish n chips since moving here 2.5 years ago, and Ive tried a few places, and I have to say this is the best so far - hence the 5 stars. Its not as good as fish n chips 'back home', but it is damn near close. The chips are proper chips not fries, and the fish was really nice with crispy batter. Would have been nice to have one whole big piece of fish as opposed to the three smaller pieces.
It was even wrapped in newspaper and came with malt vinegar and salt.

Will definitely go back again when I want a taste of home.

I can't comment on the service or interior of the shop as I sat outside in the car waiting, but I know they did cook the fish fresh.
author: sarah s.

description: My husband and I went here the other day. My hubby is from England, and I've had my fair share of fish and chips across the pond and here. This is a small shop, and doesn't look very exciting. However, the fish and chips were really, really fresh. They hand-dip their fish here, and cut their own fries. The fish looked smaller than some places, but there was a lot of fish in there, instead of being all breading at the end to make the pieces look bigger. The fish-to-batter ratio was excellent! Everything was fried, of course, but not too greasy, and the food tasted fresh. Slap on a lot of salt and vinegar, and we were in Fish and Chip heaven. We both can truthfully say that we've never had better fish and chips that on that day. We few...we happy few...we band of fish and chips brothers...
author: Kimi L.

description: This place is legit. hand battered fish that is lightly browned and cooked to perfection. this is a must eat! Oh and they only use fresh oil in their deep fryer!
author: Lawrence C.

description: Really want to like the food but it's terrible. Same nasty burnt grease from eons ago not at even close to cooking temperature, yet in goes my order. As it comes out ten minutes later, directly into the service container dripping grease from the basket all over. A single order of thick cut fries (chips) should take no effort. Here totally it was.
author: cereal y.

description:
Stumbled on this accidentally (i.e. looking for proper food after a cupcake tasting competition -- long story ...) and was suitably confused and impressed in equal measure.

As a Brit who has lived here for a long time, I was really not expecting to find a place in the Bay Area that has the whole "chippy" thing down - i.e. none of the overpriced,  healthy nonsense you find in SF British/Irish pubs - but rather the heart attack inducing massively fried, gargantuan portioned, wrapped in newspaper and swimming in vinegar version that usually accompanies a night out drinking in the UK.  

They even nailed it with the decor, and the not entirely clean appearance of the place. It doesn't have union jacks and pictures of the queen everywhere, it just looks like your average random fish and chip place.   

I'm not sure why it's here, but I like it.  I would give it five stars if they somehow added Chips & Cheese, Chips & Curry Sauce to their menu.
author: Neil S.

description: Fish wasn't crispy at all. Literally only had one container of ketchup to pass between customers.
author: Alec B.

description:
Food = good. It's fish and chips, requires a bit of grease but the flavor is good, breading isn't too heavy, and 'chips' are real potatoes!  Gotta ask for their tartar sauce.  Maybe I'll try their onion rings next time....

Service = non-existent.  Polite, nice but not exactly friendly.   Oh, and for whatever reason, this is the routine... order, wait for food, then you pay.  And it's cash only folks. Drinks are the fridge, help yourself too.  
This neighborhood leaves a lot to be desired but there is always good food around! ;)
author: Fannie S.

description: Slammin, slammin and more slammin ^_~ not to mention beautiful people who run the place. I will always visit for the homey feel.
author: Sophie P.

description: I  had the 3 piece fish and chips.  It was perfect sized for dinner.  The fish tasted like cod and was just like the fish at Mr. Fish and Chips.  It was very good for cod.  The fries were also pretty good.  It was nice watching the lady peeling potatoes for the next customer.  I'd rate them higher except Mari ordered the fried chicken and the center was cold on the first piece she tried.  Frying it again resulted in some dry chicken.  The cook offered his apologies and tried to make it right be giving her a couple extra drumettes.  I tried a drumette and it was pretty good.
author: Soo H.

description:
Food was ok -- but the place needs to be cleaner. The windows need cleaning, plus the store front. More people will come if all of this area (Polk) street was cleaned up.

Less bums and druggies in the area would be nice.
author: John G.

description:
Okay, I remember walking around  the former fishing village of Howth, Ireland with my ex boyfriend and there was something so grand about sitting on a bench on the stonewall pier, with the sea breeze blowing through my hair while munching on fried fish and chips drenched with malt vinegar and seasoning flakes in a little disposable basket and waxed paper.  Well, Piccadilly Fish & Chips isn't exactly the same, but the meal isn't that shabby either.  

The no frills establishment (with health code rating of 85 - see the wall) is absolutely what to expect of a hole in the wall fried fishery in the tendernob.  The menu is pretty self-explanatory and posted on the wall over the fryers.  The fish and fries are fried while you wait and delivered to you wrapped in newspaper.  

They accept CASH ONLY.  I would recommend dining OUT b/c there is very limited seating and honestly, it really is a HOLE in the wall. 

There is tartar sauce, salt and malt vinegar...simple, simple, simple...it's fried fish (aiyah, my arteries must be hating ME today)

Enough said!
author: Hiromi N.

description: Love this place.  Owner is super sweet and they batter and fry your fish right in front of you.  Try the combo to get a taste of it all. Have him salt it for you when he asks because there isn't any in the batter. Tartar sauce is yummy...and I like a side of coleslaw with it.
author: Patti L.

description:
Ok, first the confession... I am English, even more a proper northerner

Fish and Chips is a Friday ritual in my part of the world... a chippy tea is what Fridays were made for!

So onto the review, well it is never going to be as good as any seaside town in England, or any chippy in England for that matter, but on foreign soil this place is pretty good.

We shared the three piece fish and chips with salt and malt vinegar (very important in the world of fish and chips) meal between 3 people, admittedly we were not massively hungry but it was a large portion it would feed 2 people comfortably.

Recommended I will be visiting again!
author: Chris M.

description: I was really needing fish and chips.  I was in the neighborhood, so I went in.  The guy working there was really nice and friendly.  I really wish the food was as nice as the guy.  The fish was ok.  I got 3 smallish pieces of fish and a decent amount of fries.  The batter was very light and was not oily.  I like a heavier, more British-style of fish and chips.  It wasn't bad, but I just wanted something more.
author: Funk G.

description: Have gone here over the years, and although the staff there are very friendly, the food is just average. Having eaten Fish and Chips all over the U.S. and the U.K., it leaves much to be desired. I did take out and ate the food with a friend at the street outdoor park near the Quetzal, and was sadly disappointed. They also charge 25 cents for each container of tarter sauce, which also was a disappointment, although I do realize that costs of food is rising, still I have never been charged anywhere for a condiment. Word of advice, when you do take out, and you finally open the paper package, the steam from the food takes the crispiness out of the fish and makes the french fries soggy. I also think they should "double fry" the fries for a better "chip"...Just saying..
author: Timothy L.

description:
I am an sf native and have wanted to try this place for quite a while. 
The fish was the most nasty breaded mess..I told the guy I'm sorry but wanted my $ back..it was that horrible.  I was shocked and surprised. He was upset and rude but you know what I love fish,  and amazed these people are still in business. . The most flavor less food on planet earth
author: Athena C.

description:
Niece and I landed here before we head out to the East Bay to watch the Warrior's play @ Oracle Arena. (Yes, she was wearing the appropriate gears).

Walking in to this small takeout place with few seats, the sweet Korean family noticed us walking in with our colorful Warrior's apparel. And with the continuous frying action on the fryers, our clothes did indeed smell like a fried fish. You can easily tell that the food fried here are fresh.

We split an order of the 3 pieces English-style fish in a basket. The $7.50 meal had 3 pieces of fish fried with halibuts and a large batch of fries. The piping-hot fishes and fries were very fresh and complimented very well with the tartar sauce and the sour malt vinegar. We also bought a can soda for $1.00 each. 

Niece bumped into one of her friends and orders her food to go. After her friend and I were formally introduced, I saw that all meals taken to go are wrapped in a newspaper. And believe it or not, it was the comic-section from the San Francisco Chronicle. As they were chatting, I was reading the Peanut's comic on her wrapped food, where Snoopy was sleeping in the same bed with Charlie Brown. Later, CB kicked Snoopy out, because of the dog's loud snoring. Then, CB gave Snoopy another chance. And it was CB's turn to loudly snore. Finally, CB was sleeping on top of Snoopy's dog-house. What a cute way for a fish meal wrapped up!

Although the fried fish was a little bit greasy but tasty, the hard-working Koreans ladies were very nice, despite being on busy Polk St. This place is a cash-only place.
author: Matt G.

description:
BLIMEY! ...Ahre we back near me flat in Kensington? I miss my mum's black pudding 'n just good old bangers 'n mash, mate. But I found me some ace fish 'n chips 'ere in the colonies and...

OK, I'll stop ...since this place doesn't look anything like a London pub...it's just a non-descript place in Polk Gulch right next to the newly relocated Tajine, my favorite bargain Moroccan eatery. But if you're jonesing for some authentic fish and chips, this is probably the place to go in SF.

For $5.90, I had two good-sized pieces of fish with chips. The fish was a bit bland, but the crusty covering was really crunchy. It went well with the homemade cole slaw that they stock in the fridge. All sorts walk into the place, but you can count on the incredibly courteous Chinese couple to treat everyone equally. And I found that more refreshing than the food.

So gov'nor, if the weather is a bit parky and you fancy some pub grub, Picadilly doesn't quite take the biscuit, but it's worth dodgin' the wankers on Polk for. 

FOOD - 3.5 stars...hearty portions of fish and chips made on the spot
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...glorified lunchroom
SERVICE - 4.5 stars...a really nice owner goes a long way
TOTAL - 4 stars...where else in SF can you get such bargain-priced, homemade fish 'n chips?
author: Ed U.

description: A traditional fish & chips place, awesome food - and a great place to people watch. My favorite thing is to put both the malt vinegar and the delicious tartar sauce on my chips. The tartar sauce does cost extra, but it's well worth it. Your meal is wrapped in newspaper for a more authentic feel. It's cash only - so be sure to hit the ATM before you dine.
author: Paul R.

description:
All you need to know is that this is the BEST place for Fish and Chips. 'Nuff said. (This place got a TWO thumbs up from an old friend from England. She prefers this place to any other she's been to away from her country. Fish and Chips are one of her favorite treats.)

Another one of my go to places that has not changed....20+ years is it? The taste here has been the same as I remembered it. This place stands out from other places I have ordered fish and chips from. Is it because they use peanut oil?

If you're thinking "this guy is nuts!! Camelot (Pacifica, CA) is THE place for Fish and Chips!!" then you might be (sorta) right...Camelot is (or was) a good spot. I used to frequent Camelot often, but the last time I went there (about half a year ago) I was disappointed. Something about the fish was off...taste was not there maybe? (What I do like about Camelot is that they have Cock 'N Bull ginger soda) 

When going here, don't expect a nice place serving beer battered Fish and Chips. This is a classic hole-in-the-wall/greasy spoon type of place. Don't expect healthy anything here...it's a FISH and Chips joint people!....everything here on the menu is mostly fried. Also, parking can be tough in this area. (If driving, you should probably call in your order, and have someone with you run in to pick up your order while your car is parked in somewhere you probably shouldn't park.)

What I like to do: order a three piece fish and chips with extra malt vinegar and salt for pick-up (maybe an order of fried mushrooms also), go to a nearby market and pick up a good ginger ale, and head to Crissy Field for a picnic. Enjoy! =)
author: Paolo V.

description:
This was a great place some years ago but today is simply quiet awful.
Lots of grease and more grease - and tiny amounts of fish. Do yourself a favour and go somewhere else.
author: Robin O.

description: This place changed, and not for the good... thumbs WAY down.  Such a bummer when good places go bad.
author: J B.

description: Exploring Polk Street, I made a mental note to try this place since I do love a good batch of Fish & Chip.  Walking in, I was a bit disappointed.  It's a depressing looking restaurant and the bathroom was pretty scary.  You go through a dark hall (no idea where the light switch was) and then the bathroom was pitch dark.  Had to feel the wall for the switch.  Turn the lights on!  The customers would appreciate it.  It's a cash only place and they wrap your fish in newspaper.  The fish was good, but pretty small portion for the price.  The place felt a bit grimy and sticky - probably from all of the frying all day.  I'll think I'll pass next time.
author: Neville B.

description:
I haven't lived in San Francisco for 15 years, but when I did, this place was a Friday night favourite. Do they still wrap up the fish in newspaper when you get it to go?

I remember the couple who owned the place as being very friendly. Glad to see they're still in business with all the changes/rent increases that happen.
author: The B.

description: Wow, I hadn't been to Piccadilly in over ten years.  I go in tonight and order a combo to go -- get all the way home -- and it is the complete wrong order.  I return and they reluctantly prepare a combo -- in apparent wonder that I might be a bit irritated.  Then I get home and the entire order is only half-cooked.  Fail.  You should never have to have a bad meal in San Francisco.
author: Michael W.

description:
I read about Picadilly Fish & Chips in Patricia Unterman's San Francisco Food Lover's Guide and I am so glad I did! Usually not a fan of Fish & Chips, I must say that this little hole in the wall was greasy... but in a good way. :) 

Picadilly's also serves a variety of other fried seafood items as well as friend chicken. However, I would recommend the original Fish & Chips along with tarter sauce(have to ask for this) and malt vinegar. Mmm. Hits the spot. 

**Cash only
author: CHERiE Y.

description:
I called in for an order of fish and chips last night. The first three pieces of fish were great and the fries were great. I ordered the five piece, what was I thinking that was a lot of fish. Two of the pieces were under cooked and had to throw them out.

I would revisit, because the person working there was friendly, and the fish was great. Just will need to ask them to be sure to cook all of the fish all the way through.
author: Dean C.

description:
Surprisingly top notch fish and chips in the Loin.
Neighborhood is not the most desirable with random crazies wandering in, but it's a bare-bones, not-fancy greasy joint making better than you'd expect London-style newspaper wrapped fish and chips.
Yup, pretty darn good, heart-stopping goodness.
author: Kev M.

description:
This Fish & Chips place is been my childhhood place to eat.. The owner knows me and my parents and they are very friendly, it's too bad over the years he know me I never got to know his name...

Just recently it was sold to new ownership but same quality food never changes.. They do have another location on Larkin near Geary Street..

Great Fish and Chips!!
author: RICHARD W.

description:
Maybe they should have t-shirts "I survived Picadilly Fish & Chips." Capturing the sense of adventure, and risk, that eating the food here likely entails might make an otherwise dismal dining experience marginally more enjoyable.

I did enjoy being hand-served tartar sauce out of a beer pitcher by the proprietors of this fascinatingly still in business establishment.
author: Emily C.

description:
I love this place. The owners are so nice. Especially when my little bro is starving and this is the only place he will go on Polk Street. My only question is:

Where's the tartar sauce???
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
A proper chippy.  A real hole in the wall run by foreigners (by that I mean non-white people).  Actually, better than most I've been to in the UK (though nothing can beat Cornwall).  Much cleaner and better food for a start.  

You would think that fish and chips are all the same.  But if you think that, you're wrong.  This place gives you fish pieces instead of a whole fish fillet (a bit odd) but they are perfectly battered and fried.  I hate it when the batter is really bland and soggy and just falls off the fish.  The fries are real cut potato fries.  I was especially pleased to see none of that ketchup or tartar sauce on the counter, just salt and vinegar.

My only complaint is that the fish is a little bland.  I may have to try the squid next time (which is definitely not authentic for a chip shop).

This place only takes cash.  It's over $6 for 2 pieces of fish and a handful of chips.  I was a little taken aback by the price and the small quantity of food but it was more than enough for me but probably not enough for a big guy.

If you get it to go, yes, they will wrap it into paper for you all proper like.

Bike Parking: designated bike racks just a couple of doors down on Polk.
author: Jean K.

description:
Place is not the fanciest but common,  its a fish and chips joint.
I had a craving so I hunted this place down after a recommendation.
Victor and I shared a "Five Piece and Chips" ($15) but when the cook saw there was two of us, he threw in an extra piece. Fish was tender and flakey, chips were done to perfection.  I was a little surprised that they didn't offer lemon wedges on the side but the malt vinegar did just fine.
author: John W.

description:
Great variety of seafoods, all of which are battered and deep fried. They got a guy taking orders and one frying it up. Korean operators have been running this place for decades, very nice people. The place is very old school, looks like it hasn't changed since 1970's.

Seafood here is good and relatively fresh. Everything is cooked-to-order. Food is cheap (for seafood) and simple; nothing fancy here with your food coming out in newspaper. The fish is really tasty and done really well. The breading for the oysters were a little thick and the clams were chewy form being over cooked but overall pretty good experience.
author: Ed L.

description: Just had the two-piece fish & chips.  It was as expected - pretty consistent with all the other times.  I used to love this place in my younger days, but I think my taste buds now prefer a lighter and more crispier batter.  The fish are good-size pieces with moist cod fish.  I do agree with another review about the oil needing to be hotter for crispier results.  Their batter is a little thicker and a tad chewy at times.   I do like the chips a lot.  I just like the taste of fresh potatoes.  I always add a little malt vinegar, salt, pepper, and ask for some tarter sauce.  They are not very generous about giving lots of tarter sauce or napkins.  So I usually ask again.  They also open late!!
author: Alvin J.

description:
Best Fish and Chips I've had in the city. My girlfriend and I were on Polk looking for a place to eat and we didn't feel like burgers or the thousands of Thai restaurants in SF. So I used the monocle mode on my yelp app and saw this place.

When we entered there was no one in there so we were skeptical. But holy crap it was good. The prices are nice and low and the gentleman that runs the business is very friendly. By the time we had sat down there were four more groups ordering food.

Cover it all with vinegar and it's awesome! It may not be Fish and Ships from over seas but I have to give five stars to this place just for being so nice, cheap, and having great food.
author: Brian C.

description:
Guilty pleasure! Get your battered and deep fried fish, onions and mushroom fix here. Make sure that you eat there because the batter gets soggy and the heat from the wrapped food steams the already fried food. no fun. 

I shouldn't be eating this stuff but no one seems to stop me when i walk in. I give it a low-4
author: Michael G.

description:
piccadilly fish & chip is next to a boarded up breakfast joint at the corner of pine & polk.  the shop looks aged with white/cream overtones and the only anemities are generic  wooden table and  chairs. the tv is tuned to korean soaps.

typical fish & chip menu,: oysters, onion righs,, clams, chickens, fries, prawns.......

sampling:
2 piece fish & chip (6.40) no tax, cash only
-2 piece of fish had crispy batter but the fish was bland. flaky and watery. the fish was falling apart when i bit it. the fish wasn't crisp.
-fries not so crisp, and insides mushy. oil not hot enought?

leftovers:
-cash only
-fish wrapped in korean newspaper, not an english one,
-very fast, friendly service
-fish ready in 10 minutes, beating my meter's 15 minutes.
-meter maid's standing by.
-remembered chelsa's was better but they use pollock, cod? used here.
author: Victor G.

description:
This place has been my childhood fav since I was in 3rd grade, it was litterly behind my elementary school and still standing after all these years....it was a great mom and pop shop for thick fries and salty malt fish. 

Came back recently taste us still the same quality but now the kids and grandkids are running it. Since I always had the fish and chips I decided to try the fried oysters too, not bad but can give you the feeling of too much to handle after a couple pieces....still the fish n chips are delicious!
author: Linh D.

description:
I used to come here all the time when I was a kid going to Redding elementary around the corner. 

They wrap your food up in news paper. It's greasy and seeps through the brown paper bag before you get home. Isn't that great?!? The peices are a good size. The fries are the big chunky steak fries. I always feel like I'm going to have a heart attack everytime I open the bag, but my stomch tells me it's worth it and I dig in. 

The sweet little Korean ladies that work there (own it?) are so nice. After years of not coming here, my friend and I come back over a decade later and they still remember us! 

Note: I never eat in because of the "characters" that come in. I guess even crack heads and junkies need their fish and chips fix too. The fix after the fix.
author: Jeanette P.

description:
Fish and Chips the way it's supposed to be. Not contrived and fancy, just casual and delicious.

My British friends always tell me that this is their first choice in "real" FIsh & chips that they'd find back in the UK. They put their fish in the newspaper and fry them in large fryers. The fish tastes great and their fries are wonderfully crispy. 

Don't let the Chinese couple running this place fool you.......they definitely know what they're doing. In fact, they're probably the least authentic thing about this place.
author: Rylan C.

description: If I could I would have chosen 2.5 stars, because the gentleman cooking was very nice and they made the fish and chips to order.  With that being said, and this may be because we took them to go (we traveled may 10 minutes away), but when we opened them up the chips were hard and not that amazing, the fries were soggy.  The chicken wings were good though, maybe a little salty for my taste, but good.  The food was probably not that great because when the man cooking finished he walked out to use the phone for 10 minutes and then came back wrapped the food.  Oh, the kicker for this lack luster trip was when we wanted to add some fried zucchini to our order (there was sone sitting there) he said it was for someone else and didn't offer to cook more.  I honestly would have preferred LJS.
author: Michael H.

description: Well, look what happens.  I post on Yelp that they are closed and now they are open.  Am I that powerful?  Anyway, I grabbed two pieces of fish and some chips earlier this evening.  The fish was quite tasty.  I liked how it was both crisp and pliable.  The chips were less than stellar.  Really thick cut and not quite so fried.  And there seemed to be skimpy on the portion of the chips.
author: Jeremy G.

description: A decent place to get fish and chips.  I went last night for perhaps the 20th time in my life.  I should have asked for mine extra-crispy because my fish and chips were a little undercooked.  I was too hungry to wait though.  Still good though and the staff is nice.  Excellent place to go when you're drunk.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
Now and then, this fatty gets a craving for some fish and chips and when I want it, I WANT IT! Mmm..the sound of oil bubbling, the smell of fried golden crispy batter...it couldn't be better! 

Piccadilly is a mom and pop owned SF joint in the Tendernob. Friendly service, lots of grease, fried and battered to perfection, they serve up oysters, calamari, cod, chips, onion rings, mushrooms, etc. All with everyone's favorite 3 Monks Malt Vinegar and if you request it (and you should!) their tartar sauce. The atmosphere is a wee bit on the "loiny" side, but the tables are clean, the fish is fresh, and you couldn't ask for nicer service. I wouldn't say it's the best of the best, but darn good for a little neighborhood hole in the wall. If you get it to go, it even comes wrapped up in a newspaper.

Sometimes, you just want to say YES to fried goodness!
author: Kira R.

description:
I was in the mood for some fish and chips and decided to give this place a try. The restaurant has plenty of seating but i opted to get take out. 

I went with the 3 fish & chips combo ($8.90). They seasoned it with some salt & malt vinegar before wrapping it up to go. 

The fish was fried with a nice golden crust. The batter was flavorful but did not overpower the flavor of the fish. The fries were thick cut and weren't as crispy as the fish.
author: Phong D.

description: In one word GROSS!  The OIL the fish and onion rings was cooked in was SO OLD that the coating did not get a fried golden brown color, it was totally WHITE and the fish was limp!  This place use to have good food years ago but now is a TOTAL DUMP and smells and looks like it!!  I will NEVER go back to this place ever!
author: San Francisco D.

description:
I've been hitting this place steadily over the past 10 years. 
Its Fish & Chips folks not a 4 star restaurant & let me tell you its the best option in SF & not the only.
I'd have given them 5 stars if they opened a little later so I could get my grease fix after a few drinks.
I've had fish & chips in Ireland & the UK & this is the closest you'll get here, as far as regular street shops go, not to be confused with Bar/Pub food as they add beer to the batter & its just different compared to this.
I recommend it.
author: Jennifer R.

description:
The prices here are so great (hecka cheap) for the food they pile on  your tray.

Faithy, Hope, and Grace each had the combination plate:
1 fish, 2 shrimp, 3 oysters, onion rings and chips.... for $9.90!

The Korean couple who ran this joint were hecka cute.  The man was in charge of frying, and the woman with ringing up the orders and getting the food from the back storage.  She first calculates your total on a calculator, shows it to you, collects your money.... then punches the total on an old school cash register.... 

The food is made to order, so it's HOT when it comes out... each table has its own bottle of malt vinegar and a shaker of salt.  If you want tartar sauce, they will come out with a bucket and scoop you up some on your tray.  I like this because it eliminates the plastic waste (other places would have those little condiment cups).


oh dang..... LOVE the chips... the oysters were hecka good.  The fish and shrimp was not bland.  None were drowning in batter.  We finished our meal properly with carbonated beverages in aluminum cans.

Definitely would come back here... One of the better (if not best) fish n' chips hole in the wall joint in San Francisco.

( | )

P.S..... the lady is not mean... she just looks like that.
author: Grace M.

description:
I am truly sorry to the owner of this store for having to rate them so low. Let me preface this review by saying that while I am working, I always try to find local restaurants to dine at during my lunch. Today was no exception, but in hindsight, I wish it was. The price wasn't very reasonable for the portions delivered. The batter used added no flavor or texture to the food. The fish was bland and only made more bland by the batter that was added. Salt and vinegar did nothing to improve the flavor by any means. The onion rings were not fresh, and again, after being bettered with a bland coating, were rendered almost inedible. I only decided to write this review because of the level of discomfort I am experiencing in my stomach at the moment. I feel dizzy, a little nauseous, and the worst part is my work day is not even half over. I take pity on the poor soul that has to come after me into the restroom after this meal rears its ugly head.

Living in San Francisco has given me a wide array of foods to choose from, and this is not up to the standards.

For a comparison, I'd rather have a McDonald's Fillet-o-Fish sandwich then dine here again.
author: Graham U.

description:
Authentic fish and chips. This place is not for everyone if you cannot handle a lot of grease. The batter soaks up all the grease which makes it super flavorful but super duper greasy. The fish is delish! They apparently import their cod fish from Ireland. Don't forget to try their homemade tartar sauce. It is a MUST. The fried mushrooms are also excellent.

If your stomach can handle the grease, stop by Piccadilly.
author: David W.

description:
fish and chips place run by a korean family? how did this business come about? the whole family was there when i was eating. they were very genial and laid-back, which i liked.

the fish and the chips i got were a little underfried but that's ok because i didn't expect too much from this place. but you have to ask for their homemade tartar sauce.
author: Te R.

description:
If I could give this place 3.5 stars.  This place is ok and it satisfied my monthly craving for something greasy.  The items are made to order, so your order is piping hot when you get it.  I got the sampler with fish, onion rings, fries, oysters and shrimp.  The shrimp was a bit salty, but the rest of the stuff was just right.  The shrimp and oysters have a tight breaded and fried, whereas the onion rings and fish were dipped in a batter.  After getting halfway through this stuff, I couldn't eat anymore batter, not because it tasted bad, but because I'm on a diet.  I suppose stripping off the batter from 1/2 of the fish and onion rings qualifies this to be low/reduced fat.

I couldn't eat here more than once a month, but that's just me. This is everything I expected ... no more and no less.
author: Rod C.

description:
I've generally found that fish and chips are simply fish and chips, whether they're served in a restaurant with white tablecloths and fancy decor, or a simple casual joint like this one. 

Actually, cross that. The fish and chips here beats most. Yes, they're just fish and chips, but they use cod, not pollock, which has a much better texture and flavor. Also, their cod isn't frozen, unfrozen and refrozen multiple times along the supply chain, the way many other joints' are. 

In addition to classic fish and chips (with a good dose of malt vinegar, if you like it that way - which I do), they also have other items like zucchini, squid, onion rings and chicken. 

The joint has been with the same (extended) Korean family for a while - believe the part of the family that's running it today is also the family that used to run a Scottish pub, Edinburgh Castle, back in the 90s.
author: Jay K.

description:
After a long day of craving fish and chips at work, what better place to go than Piccadilly on Polk. This place has been here for quite a while.
